macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: US Senate Negotiations Intensify on Crypto Market Structure Bill Ahead of Jan. 15 Markup
items.summary: Senators are continuing negotiations on a major US crypto market structure bill, with a formal markup scheduled for Jan. 15 by the Senate Banking Committee, signaling potential near-term changes for trading platforms and digital asset oversight.

items.title: FDIC Proposes Licensing Regime for Banks Issuing Stablecoins Under GENIUS Act
items.summary: The FDIC has proposed new licensing rules for insured banks seeking to issue stablecoins through subsidiaries and to engage in stablecoin-related activities, implementing key provisions of the recently enacted GENIUS Act and formalizing federal standards for payment stablecoins.

items.title: World Liberty Financial, Trump-Linked Crypto Firm, Applies for OCC National Trust Bank Charter
items.summary: World Liberty Financial, a crypto company affiliated with the Trump family, has applied for a national trust bank charter from the OCC to issue its USD1 stablecoin and streamline customer use and conversion of the token.

items.title: Wyoming Launches First State-Backed Blockchain Asset Styled as a Stablecoin
items.summary: Wyoming has announced issuance of what it calls the first state-backed stablecoin, described as the first blockchain-based asset backed by a U.S. state, expanding experimentation with government-linked digital assets at the state level.

items.title: BlackRock Report Highlights Historic Shift in Stablecoin Settlement Toward Single Dominant Blockchain
items.summary: A new BlackRock report cited in crypto market coverage describes a historic structural shift in digital asset markets in which stablecoin settlement activity has consolidated around a single dominant blockchain, raising questions about network concentration and systemic importance.

items.title: Coinbase Suspends Peso-Based Services in Argentina Amid Local Market Adjustments
items.summary: Coinbase has paused its peso-based services in Argentina, according to recent regional crypto coverage, reflecting changing strategies by major exchanges in response to local currency and regulatory conditions.

items.title: Trump Media Group Plans Digital Token Distribution to Shareholders
items.summary: Trump Media Group is preparing to distribute a digital token to its shareholders, indicating a new tokenization-style initiative tied to a publicly visible media and political brand and adding to the intersection of U.S. politics and crypto assets.

items.title: Philippines Confirms 49 Registered Cryptocurrency Exchanges in Growing Regulated Market
items.summary: Regulatory updates highlighted that 49 cryptocurrency exchanges are now registered in the Philippines, underscoring continued formalization and licensing of trading platforms in the jurisdiction.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Development Accelerating with New Moore's Law: Doubling Every 4 Months
items.summary: AI capabilities are doubling every 4 months instead of the traditional 2-year cycle, marking a significant acceleration in development speed. This exponential growth is reshaping how AI companies structure themselves, moving toward smaller, flatter teams optimized for rapid innovation.

items.title: MIT and Microsoft Develop CleaveNet: AI System for Cancer Detection
items.summary: Researchers at MIT and Microsoft have created CleaveNet, an AI system that designs protein sequences to detect hidden signs of disease by turning enzyme activity into measurable signals. This breakthrough enables more precise drug targeting and imaging with reduced unintended effects.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Advances Humanoid Robot Learning Through Video Analysis
items.summary: Boston Dynamics has developed an AI-powered humanoid robot that learns factory tasks by watching human workers, processing video and sensor data to create reusable skills. The robot can recombine these skills to perform new tasks without manual programming.

items.title: Sandia Labs Creates Energy-Efficient Neuromorphic Supercomputer Algorithm
items.summary: Scientists at Sandia National Laboratories developed an algorithm enabling neuromorphic hardware to solve complex fluid dynamics equations using brain-like spiking-neuron patterns. The system delivers accurate results while consuming significantly less energy than traditional CPU or GPU supercomputers.

items.title: CES 2026 Showcases Physical AI Integration Across Consumer Products
items.summary: CES 2026 demonstrated AI's expansion into physical products including AI-powered home chefs, shape-shifting beds, humanoid robots for elderly care, and personalized automotive cockpits. Major companies like Nvidia, Mercedes-Benz, LG, and Bosch showcased AI-driven innovations moving from digital to physical applications.

items.title: Open Source AI Models Becoming Increasingly Powerful and Accessible
items.summary: Smaller open-source AI models are now capable of running on laptops while delivering performance comparable to larger systems. This democratization of AI is enabling faster innovation and making advanced capabilities accessible beyond large tech companies.

items.title: Research Warns AI May Erode Human Reasoning and Critical Thinking
items.summary: Innovation theorist John Nosta and researchers at Oxford University Press warn that AI's polished responses can weaken human judgment by providing answers before workers think critically. Studies show AI creates an illusion of expertise while quietly eroding underlying skills and independent thinking.

items.title: Pittsburgh Startup StockSnips Uses AI to Analyze Financial News
items.summary: StockSnips, a North Side Pittsburgh startup, has developed an AI-driven investing system that reads financial news the way investors do to inform investment decisions.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
